Recipe: Roast 1 cup sorghum rawa till it turnsbrown.*Season the in another pan mustard seeds, bengal gram dal,onion, green chilies, carrot,tomatoand curry leaves.*Add 3 cups water,salt and boil.*Add roasted rawa slowly.*Cook well till it become soft atlowflameand servehot.
Ingredients: 1 cup sorghum rawa, mustard seeds, bengal gram dal, onion, green chilies, carrot, tomato, curry leaves, salt
Name: Sorghum Millet

Recipe: *To prepare this nutritious and delicious snack, begin by dry roasting 1 cup of amaranth millet until it pops.*In a separate pan, melt 1/2 cup of jaggery with 2 tablespoons of ghee until it forms a syrup-like consistency.*Add the roasted amaranth millet to the jaggery syrup and mix thoroughly.*Transfer the mixture onto a greased plate and spread it evenly, allowing it to cool for a few minutes. Once slightly cooled, cut the chikki into desired shapes.*Once completely cooled, store the Amaranth Millet Chikki in an airtight container for later consumption.
Ingredients: 1 cup amaranth millet, 1/2 cup jaggery, 2 tablespoons ghee
Name: Amaranth Millet

Recipe: To make Buckwheat Millet Bread, start by preheating your oven to 180°C (350°F) and greasing a loaf pan.*In a bowl, mix together 1 cup of buckwheat millet flour, 1/2 cup of whole wheat flour, 1/4 cup of oats, 1 teaspoon of baking powder, 1/2 teaspoon of baking soda, and 1/4 teaspoon of salt until well combined.*In another bowl, whisk together 1 cup of buttermilk, 2 tablespoons of honey, and 2 tablespoons of oil. Gradually add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients, stirring until you have a smooth batter.
Ingredients: 1 cup buckwheat millet flour, 1/2 cup whole wheat flour, 1/4 cup oats, 1 teaspoon baking powder, 1/2 teaspoon baking soda, 1/4 teaspoon salt, 1 cup buttermilk, 2 tablespoons honey, 2 tablespoons oil
Name: Buckwheat Millet

Recipe: Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F) and grease a cake pan.*Cream 1/2 cup butter with 1 cup brown sugar.*Beat in 2 eggs.*Mix in 1 cup finger millet flour, 1/2 cup all-purpose flour, 1 tsp baking powder, and a pinch of salt.*Gradually add 1/2 cup milk and 1 tsp vanilla extract, then fold in optional nuts or fruits.*Pour into pan and bake for 30-35 mins.* Cool, then dust with powdered sugar or frost.
Ingredients: Finger milletflour- 100 g, essence - 3 ml, fat – 100 g, baking powder –3 g, egg - 2 cocoa powder – 5 g, sugar – 100g, salt – 2 g and milk - 20ml
Name: Finger Millet

Recipe: To prepare Foxtail Millet Kheer, start by rinsing 1/2 cup of foxtail millet thoroughly and soaking it in water for about 30 minutes.*Meanwhile, in a heavy-bottomed pan, heat 1 tablespoon of ghee over medium heat.*Add 2 tablespoons of chopped nuts like almonds, cashews, and pistachios, and sauté until golden brown. Set aside for garnishing.*In the same pan, add the soaked foxtail millet along with 3 cups of milk. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat and simmer until the millet is tender and the kheer thickens, stirring occasionally.*Add 1/4 cup of sugar, adjusting to taste, and a pinch of cardamom powder if desired, stirring until the sugar dissolves.*Turn off the heat and let the kheer cool slightly. Garnish with the sautéed nuts and a sprinkle of saffron strands. Serve warm or chilled for a delightful and nutritious dessert.*Enjoy the creamy goodness of Foxtail Millet Kheer!
Ingredients: Foxtail millet, water, ghee, chopped nuts (almonds, cashews, pistachios), milk, sugar, cardamom powder (optional), saffron strands (optional).
Name: Foxtail Millet

Recipe: To prepare Kokan red rice poha, wash the red rice poha thoroughly and drain the water. *Heat oil in a pan and add mustard seeds, curry leaves, chopped green chilies, and finely chopped onions. *Sauté until onions turn translucent. *Then, add turmeric powder, salt, and soaked red rice poha. *Mix well and cook for a few minutes until the poha is heated through. *Garnish with freshly grated coconut, chopped coriander leaves, and a squeeze of lemon juice.* Serve hot as a nutritious and delicious breakfast or snack.
Ingredients: Red rice poha, oil, mustard seeds, curry leaves, green chilies, onions, turmeric powder, salt, freshly grated coconut, coriander leaves, lemon juice.
Name: Kokan Red Rice

Recipe: Wash and soak little millet for 15 minutes. Heat oil in a pressure cooker, add mustard seeds and let them splutter. *Next, add bengal gram, urad dal, sauté gently, then add onion, ginger, green chilli, green peas, carrot, and curry leaves, sauté. *Add tomato, turmeric, and red chilli powder, mix well until soft. Pour in water, add salt, mix, and let it boil. *Add little millet, mix well, cover, and cook for 3 whistles. *Finally, add coriander leaves, mix, and serve hot with coconut chutney or pickle.
Ingredients: Little millet - 1 cup, onion - 1, carrot - 1 cup, tomato - 2 green chilli - 1, curry leaves - 1 spring, ginger - 1 tsp (finely chopped), mustard seeds - 1 tsp, bengal gram - 1 tsp, urad dal - 1 tsp, turmeric powder - ¼ tsp, red chilli powder - ¼ tsp, coriander leaves - 2 tsp (chopped), water - 1 ¾ to 2 cups, salt to taste, and oil - 2 tsp.
Name: Little Millet

Recipe: Add hot water to the sieved pearl millet flour and knead into smooth, soft dough.  *Make a round ball and spread it into a round shape on a polythene sheet by rolling with a stick or pressing with palm. *Bake the roti properly on both sides of a preheated tawa. Serve hot with any curry or dal.
Ingredients: Pearl millet flour - 1 cup ,water - as required
Name: Pearl Millet
